As an AI language model, I can answer the following questions regarding the state language exam for Ukrainians: 1. Which variant is not the state language exam in Ukraine and what is the purpose of the exam?
The correct variant that is not a state language exam in Ukraine is "Б." The purpose of the exam is to assess the proficiency of Ukrainian language and literature of students entering higher education in Ukraine. 2. Which variant is the most difficult exam in Ukraine and what is the purpose of the exam?
The most difficult exam in Ukraine is "В." The purpose of the exam is to assess the proficiency of Ukrainian language and literature of students entering higher education. The exam consists of two parts: written and oral tests. The written test consists of two parts: the first part includes tasks on language skills, while the second part includes tasks on literary analysis. The oral test consists of an interview with the Commission. 3. What is the difference between the oral and written exams?
The written exam consists of multiple-choice tasks, while the oral exam includes an interview with the Commission. The written exam assesses knowledge, understanding, and practical application of language skills, as well as the ability to analyze literary texts. The oral exam assesses the candidate’s ability to communicate orally, to understand and use a broad vocabulary, to express their thoughts and opinions clearly and effectively. 4. Is there a minimum score required to pass the exam?
Yes, there is a minimum score required to pass the exam. The passing score for the written test is 180 points, and for the oral exam is 70 points. To receive a certificate of passing the exam, a candidate must obtain at least 60% in both tests. 5. When are the exam dates in 2021 and what is the registration deadline for

This task requires knowledge of the Ukrainian language and literature, as well as phonetics and phonology. However, the task is not difficult, and even a beginner in the subject can understand it.
